meanings.sent1: The dark clouds in the sky were troubling for the farmers waiting for rain.
meanings.sent2: The troubling news about the upcoming storm made everyone anxious.
meanings.sent3: It was troubling to see the cat trying to climb the tall tree with no success.
meanings.sent4: The troubling sound of thunder echoed through the valley, signaling the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The troubling feeling in her chest grew stronger as the deadline approached.

meanings.sent1: The eerie silence in the abandoned house was troubling to the visitors.
meanings.sent2: The troubling movie left a lasting impression on the audience.
meanings.sent3: It was troubling to watch the clown trying to juggle while wearing oversized shoes.
meanings.sent4: The troubling image of the ghostly figure lingered in his mind long after he left the haunted house.
meanings.sent5: The troubling dream of falling from a great height woke her up in a cold sweat.

meanings.definition: A source of concern or anxiety
meanings.sent1: The troubling in the stock market caused many investors to panic.
meanings.sent2: The troubling of the unknown future kept her up at night.
meanings.sent3: The troubling of the missing keys turned out to be a simple case of forgetfulness.
meanings.sent4: The troubling of the leaky faucet was finally fixed by the plumber.
meanings.sent5: The troubling of the strange noise outside made the dog bark incessantly.
